item.title: The 29 Steps of a Documentation Project
item.description: Here is a traditionally recommended general sequence of the 29 steps for a documentation project: Discuss the need for the document with your client. Determine the purpose and objectives of the document. Talk to intended users of the documents. Profile the usersâ€™ information needs. Prepare an outline of the planned contents of the documents Design the layout of the document. Plan the online version of the document. Prepare style guidelines or a style sheet.
